type="ucdt"><font color="#00FFAA">Warden Hadley:</font> Hey, soldier. Buying the latest and greatest is fine, but there there's an art to keeping things running. A lost art, really. Heck, I bet you can't do it. Prove me wrong and I'll give you something shiny.</str>

type="ucdt"><font color="#00FFAA">Coordinator Tolland:</font> Halfway there, operative. Hopefully those crystals aren't putting up too much of a fight.</str>

type="ucdt">One of the research team members was able to escape the now-flooded subterranean Oshur facility. Despite serious injuries, they may still be able to give some insight on what happened to the rest of their crew, as well as what necessitated the secrecy of a research project being conducted beneath the derelict genetics lab on a once-abandoned continent.</str>

type="ucdt">This is a Heavy Assault training mission, soldier. With the Heavy Assault class, equip your rocket launcher to damage armored targets, like tanks and aircraft. Your Nanite Mesh Generator ability will help reduce the damage from incoming fire, but will slow your movement while it is active. You're not invincible, so work with your team to help push into enemy bases.</str>

type="ucdt">Each year, the sights of Auraximas stir the spirits of soldiers everywhere; a reminder to take time for one another, and focus not only on the war, but the wonderland in which we wage it. <br><br><ui><li><font size="28" color="#ACE1E5">Snowman</font> dot the landscape, and can be destroyed for extra experience.</li><font size="11"><br></font><li><font size="28" color="#ACE1E5">Sanctuary</font> has received uplifting Auraximas lights and sounds, and gifts for all.</li><font size="11"><br></font><li>There is a new holiday <font size="28" color="#ACE1E5">Directive</font> as well as special daily <font size="28" color="#ACE1E5">Missions</font> to partake in.</li><font size="11"><br></font><li>Check your <font size="28" color="#ACE1E5">Loadout Screen</font> for holiday themed C-4, Ammunition Packs, and a deployable Tactical Snowman.</li><font size="11"><br></font><li><font size="28" color="#ACE1E5">The Depot</font> is stuffed with seasonal items, and other goodies.</li></ui><br><br>Merry Auraximas, soldiers!</str>

type="ucdt">Despite a common goal and shared purpose, Esamir remains a warzone. Soldiers from each empire race to The Shattered Warpgate not only to survey the damage at the behest of Nanite Systems, but to glean any additional information that can be shared with their own command structure, picking at the bones of the ancient alien technology. It's too early to say what rewards these expeditions will yield, but a feeling of urgency permeates the icy tundra.</str>

type="ucdt">Since its release in 1999, EverQuest has enveloped players in its deep and immersive fantasy world, and is known as the grandfather of the current day MMORPG. The game and its legacy continues to grow as new expansions and content are released for the loyal inhabitants of Norrath.<br><br>We've added a unique directive line to help celebrate EverQuest's storied twenty year history, through the collection of lore elements scattered throughout each continent! type="ucdt">While not as important to lore, this character is incredibly important to the MMO genre and helped define true difficulty in MMOs. Mata Muram was the first boss to ever require specific players to perform timely actions, or else cause the raid to wipe. This boss was so difficult that it took 6 months for the first guild to kill it, and nearly another month for the second guild to kill it. A year after its release, a total of only 16 guilds had defeated Mata Muram.</str>

type="ucdt">This is a rapid deployment training mission, soldier. Want to get into the thick of the action? We've given you a free pass to the front lines. Press your "Join Combat" key ("J" by default) to enable a rapid deployment into contested territory. There is a limit to how often we can deploy you to the front this way, so use it to get to new battles if the fighting nearby has simmered down, or to reach a new location if you're severely outnumbered in your current combat area.</str>
